remarks.format:
## 解説 The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] data binding model enables you to associate <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> with a <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> object. If your source object implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IDataErrorInfo> interface, you can use the built\-in rule <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataErrorValidationRule> to check for errors raised by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IDataErrorInfo> implementation.
An alternative syntax to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataErrorValidationRule> explicitly is to set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidatesOnDataErrors%2A> property to **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** on your <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.
You can create a custom rule by creating a class that derives from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule>. For more information and a detailed discussion of data validation, see [Data Binding Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/c707c95f-7811-401d-956e-2fffd019a211).
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataErrorValidationRule> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [.NET Framework 3.5 Architecture](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/f75a72de-e2f2-4a7a-9574-3f278684ea90).
